examples: The burning embers and the dry wind quickly set the whole neighbourhood alight.
The sticks were damp and wouldn’t catch alight .

definitions.definition: Often followed by with : shining with light ; luminous , radiant ; also, brightly coloured ; vivid .

subdefinitions.definition: Of an electrical light source : switched on and emitting light.

examples: Her face was alight with happiness.

secondary_definitions: Often followed by with : shining with light ; luminous , radiant ; also, brightly coloured ; vivid .
( figuratively ) Aglow with activity or emotion .
